content:
• Monday, November 20, 2017
  • MLNX

    Starboard Value discloses 10.7% stake in Mellanox, wants to explore sale

    • Mellanox Technologies (NASDAQ:MLNX) +5.8% after-hours as Starboard Value discloses taking a 10.7% stake in the company and urges MLNX to improve its margins and explore a potential sale.
    • Starboard says MLNX is spending too much on R&D and other corporate expenses to sufficiently grow revenue, sacrificing margins compared with peers, and wants the company to improve its operations and potentially explore a deal to boost the stock.
    • Marvell Technology (NASDAQ:MRVL) recently approached MLNX about a potential deal but was rebuffed, Starboard says, a response that convinced the activist investor that MLNX was hostile to potential deals, WSJ reports.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:31 PM | 5 Comments
  • SNCR

    Synchronoss Tech -4% after receiving Nasdaq warning

    • Synchronoss Technologies (NASDAQ:SNCR) -3.9% after-hours as it reports receiving an anticipated letter from Nasdaq saying its stock is subect to suspension and delisting procedures unless it requests a hearing before a Nasdaq panel by Nov. 22, which the company says it will do.
    • SNCR says it will present its plan to regain compliance at the hearing and request the continued listing of its shares on Nasdaq while it works to become current in its periodic public filings with the SEC.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:10 PM | 3 Comments

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5.25 p.m.: ASYS +13.3%. PANW +5.9%. CRR +3.8%. ARDX +3.6%. VCO-OLD +3.6%.
    • Top losers, as of 5.25p.m.: ZTO -11.1%. DS -10.1%. SN -10.1%. A -4.9%. SNCR -3.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM
  • VIPS

    Vipshop Holdings up in late trade after Q3 revenue beat

    • Vipshop Holdings (NYSE:VIPS) is up 1.6% after hours, recouping some of today's losses, after posting Q3 earnings where revenues showed solid growth and beat analyst expectations.
    • Revenues grew more than 27% to 15.3B yuan (about $2.3B). Gross profit rose 19.4% to 3.5B yuan (about $526M).
    • Net income (non-GAAP), meanwhile, dipped slightly to 559.8M yuan (about $84.1M) vs. a year-ago 595.5M yuan.
    • Active customers (trailing 12 months) rose 22% to 60.5M; total orders were up 23% Y/Y to 74M.
    • For Q4, it's expecting total net revenue of 22.8B-23.8B yuan ( ), a growth rate of 20-25%.
    • Conference call to come tomorrow at 8 a.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 5:28 PM | 18 Comments
  • CLSN

    Celsion builds on up move ahead of ThermoDox study data; shares ahead 20% after hours

    • Nano cap Celsion (NASDAQ:CLSN) is up 20% after hours on robust volume, adding to today's 8% move on lighter-than-normal volume. Investors appear to be taking positions ahead a November 27 presentation of results from a Phase 1 study, TARDOX, evaluating the feasibility of a ThermoDox/focused ultrasound combination to treat liver tumors. The data will be presented at RSNA in Chicago.
    • The primary endpoint of the study was the doxorubicin concentration in tumor biopsies before and after focused ultrasound-mediated hyperthermia as measured by high performance liquid chromatography.
    • ThermoDox is encapsulated doxorubicin. After infusion, it is heated to a specific temperature which releases the cancer drug directly into a tumor.
    • Previously: Celsion up 8% on HEAT study publication and therapeutic potential of ThermoDox + RFA (Oct. 16)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM | 11 Comments
  • PANW

    Palo Alto Networks +6.7% after Q1 beats, upside guidance

    • Palo Alto Networks (NYSE:PANW) shares are up 6.7% aftermarket following a Q1 report that beat EPS and revenue estimates and featured upside guidance. Q2 guidance has revenue from $518M to $528M (consensus: $519.89M) and EPS from $0.78 to $0.80 (consensus: $0.77).
    • FY18 guidance: revenue, $2.145B to $2.185B (consensus: $2.15B); EPs, $3.35 to $3.41 (consensus: $3.32). 
    • Financials: Cash from operating activities, $274.1M; FCF, $241.9M; operating expenses, $418.4M; cash and equivalents, $842.6M, current liabilities, $1.7B. 
    • Staff change: Palo Alto announces Kathy Bonanno as the new CFO. Bonanno has worked at Palo Alto since 2014 and previously worked at Symantec. 
    • Press release  
    • Previously: Palo Alto Networks beats by $0.05, beats on revenue (Nov. 20)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM
  • CO

    China Cord Blood fiscal Q2 top line up 27%; earnings up 307%; cash flow ops up 58%

    • China Cord Blood (NYSE:CO) fiscal Q2 results (RMB millions): Revenues: 234.6 (+27.4%).
    • Net Income: 67.6 (+307.2%); EPS: 0.60 (+172.7%); CF Ops: 215.3 (+58.0%).
    • Subscriber base as of 9/30: 620.7K.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM | 4 Comments
  • INTU

    Intuit reports Q1 beats, in-line guidance

    • Intuit (NASDAQ:INTU) shares are down nearly 1% aftermarket despite Q1 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates. Q2 guidance has revenue from $1.16B to $1.18B (consensus: $1.12B) and EPS from $0.31 to $0.34 (consensus: $0.32).
    • FY18 guidance: revenue, $5.64B to $5.74B (consensus: $5.69B); EPS, $4.90 to $5.00 (consensus: $4.95). 
    • Segment revenue growth: Small Business & Self-Employed Group, +17%; Consumer and Strategic Partner Groups, +7%. 
    • Key metrics: QuickBooks Online subscribers, 2.55M (+56%); QuickBooks Online Self-Employed, 425K. 
    • Press release     
    • Previously: Intuit beats by $0.06, beats on revenue (Nov. 20)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM | 2 Comments
  • A

    Agilent fiscal Q4 top line up 7%; earnings up 41%; cash flow ops up 23%; soft Q1 guidance sinks shares, down 5% after hours

    • Agilent (NYSE:A) fiscal Q4 results ($M): Revenues: 1,189 (+7.0%); Life Sciences: 575 (+4.9%); Diagnostics and Genomics: 210 (+8.8%); CrossLab: 404 (+9.2%).
    • Net Income: 177 (+40.6%); Non-GAAP Net Income: 218 (+13.0%); EPS: 0.54 (+42.1%); Non-GAAP EPS: 0.67 (+13.6%); CF Ops: 288 (+23.1%).
    • Fiscal 2018 Guidance: Revenues: $4.72B - 4.74B; Non-GAAP EPS: $2.50 - 2.56.
    • Fiscal Q1 Guidance: Revenues: $1.145B - 1.165B; Non-GAAP EPS: $0.55 - 0.57.
    • Fiscal Q1 consensus is EPS of $0.60 on revenues of $1.15B.
    • Shares are down 5% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM | 3 Comments
  • URBN

    Urban Outfitters rallies after earnings

    • Urban Outfitters (NASDAQ:URBN) tops revenue estimates with its Q3 report after knocking out a 1% increase in comparable sales in the retail segment.
    • Wholesale segment sales increased 8.7% during the quarter.
    • Gross margin came in at 34.1% of sales, level with the expectation of analysts.
    • Previously: Urban Outfitters beats by $0.08, beats on revenue (Nov. 20)
    • URBN +6.12% AH to $30.00.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • ASYS

    Amtech beats by $0.42, beats on revenue

    • Amtech (NASDAQ:ASYS): Q4 EPS of $0.51 beats by $0.42.
    • Revenue of $54.7M (+29.0% Y/Y) beats by $7.8M.
    • Shares +8.6%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM | 5 Comments
  • HAIN

    Hain Celestial jumps on talk of Nestle interest

    • Hain Celestial (HAIN +2.5%) jumps after Bloomberg reports that Nestle (OTCPK:NSRGY) is interested in making a bid for the food company.
    • Preliminary talks between Nestle and Hain about a full or partial sale have already taken place.
    • Hain has been the subject of several speculative M&A stories in the past.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM | 13 Comments
  • GE

    Moody's notes 'mounting challenges' for GE

    • Coming on the heels of last week's credit rating downgrade of General Electric (GE -1.3%), Moody's says any cash flow benefit from the halving of the dividend will be outweighed by "mounting end-market challenges."
    • The agency expects "severe deterioration" in GE's power business at least through the end of 2019, continued weakness in oil and gas, and struggles in transportation.
    • Full report (subscription required)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM | 41 Comments
  • DY

    Dycom +9% on stronger than expected quarter, outlook for new projects

    • Dycom Industries (DY +8.7%) surges higher after reporting better than expected FQ1 earnings and weak guidance for the January quarter, but it says 1 GB connections are in demand; DY issued its report a day earlier than planned because it says certain documents were subject to unauthorized access after the market closed on Friday.
    • DY says it expects total contract revenues for the current quarter of $645M-$675M, down from $756M for FQ1 largely because of a short-term moderation by one of its larger customers; quarterly revenues thereafter should range from in-line to a low single digit increase as a percentage of revenue compared to the year-ago quarter.
    • DY says fiber deployments in contemplation of newly emerging wireless technologies have begun in many parts of the U.S., and expects a "significant number" of new project initiations to occur "in the near term."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM | 1 Comment
  • TWX

    Time Warner -1%; DOJ said ready to announce merger lawsuit

    • Time Warner (NYSE:TWX) shares are taking a sudden dip, down 1%, on word that an impending antitrust announcement involves news of a Justice Dept. lawsuit to stop a takeover by AT&T (T +0.8%).
    • The DOJ will brief the media this afternoon on some antitrust news; a person familiar with the announcement tells Bloomberg it's about the $85B T-TWX deal.
    • Updated 3:31 p.m.: Time Warner's now down 1.4% (AT&T shed top gains but is up 0.4%) and other media stocks are feeling at least a mild headwind: DIS -0.7%; CBS -1.4%; FOXA -2%; CMCSA -1.1%; VIAB -0.2%.
    • Updated 4:18 p.m.: Executives from AT&T and Time Warner will hold a press conference at 5:30 p.m.; AT&T chief Randall Stephenson will speak. (view here)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM | 88 Comments
  • BLMN

    Bloomin' Brands spikes after Jana Partners applies pressure

    • Bloomin' Brands (BLMN +11.5%) spikes after Jana Partners discloses that it holds a 8.74% stake in the company and will push for a review of strategic options, including a potential sale.
    • SEC Form 13D
     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM | 2 Comments
  • PENN

    Penn National Gaming continues to track higher

    • Barclays lifts its price target on Penn National Gaming (PENN +1.8%) to $30 amid continuing enthusiasm over the casino company's prospects.
    • The investment firm moves its valuation on the stock higher due to Penn's improved margins profile and the undercurrent of M&A potential in the sector.
    • Shares of Penn National Gaming have doubled this year and struck a new multi-year high of $28.02 earlier today.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM

  • Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:55 pm

    • Gainers: TSRI +28%. XNET +23%. MARK +18%. ATOM +15%. CPSH +14%.

  • MTW

    Manitowoc upped to Buy at Seaport as reverse split takes effect

    • Manitowoc (MTW +2.6%) is upgraded to Buy from Neutral at Seaport Global with a new $48 price target is $48 from a reverse-split adjusted $38, as the company's 1-for-4 reverse split takes effect today.
    • In the past, MTW's strong execution on the turnaround was more than offset by further downside in the crane cycle, but this time around, Seaport says the company detected more confidence that end markets are in a bottoming phase, and that new products such as the TMS9000-2 which were not available last year are gaining traction.
    • Seaport also notes MTW's towers are booked well through H1 2018 and competitor comments on boom truck demand remain very positive.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • ZIOP

    Ziopharm gives up early gains

    • "Virus in the head still gives up headaches," writes Guggenheim's Tony Butler. A Phase 3 trial, he says, will be necessary to clarify the benefit of Ad-RTS-IL-12 + veledimex.
    • Source: Bloomberg
    • ZIOP is reversing sharp early gains, now down 3.8% on the session.
    • Previously: ZIOPHARM's gene therapy candidate Ad-RTS-hIL-12 shows positive effect in treatment-resistant brain cancer in early-stage study; shares ahead 13% premarket (Nov. 20)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM | 12 Comments
  • CHU

    Philippines courts Chinese entry into domestic telecom market

    • Philippine President Rodrigue Duterte says he's offering China a chance to come in and compete against what he calls a telecom duopoly.
    • It's not clear, though, whether China's state-owned telecoms would take him up on it, including dominant player China Mobile (CHL +0.3%), China Telecom (CHA -1%) or China Unicom (NYSE:CHU) -- all of which have been slow to expand beyond a sheltered home market.
    • The Philippine market is dominated by Globe Telecom (GTMEY -1.1%) and PLDT (PHI -2.3%).
    • An attempted entry by China's ZTE (OTCPK:ZTCOY) to build a national broadband network in 2007 was scrapped after allegations of overpricing and kickbacks.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM

  • Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm

    • Gainers: NTIC +17%. SNMX +14%. SDPI +12%. WMLP-OLD +11%. PEIX +8%.
    • Losers: GNE -10%. CENX -10%. IO -9%. SQM -7%. CRC -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM | 6 Comments
  • LKM

    NQ Mobile gets another $60M in divestment payments; shares +2.5%

    • In its latest update on payments tied to its divestment of FL Mobile and the Showself live social video business, NQ Mobile (NQ +2.5%) says it's gotten an additional 400M yuan in payments.
    • That brings the total received from Tongfang Investment Fund Series SPC to 1.35B yuan of a previously agreed 3.32B yuan (about $500M). The entire sum was to come by the end of May, but Tongfang had said it needed more time.
    • Just over a week ago, Tongfang had made an additional payment of 800M yuan. It says it's still committed to completing the entire transaction.
    • Alongside the news, NQ says it negotiated with Zhongzhi Hi-Tech Overseas Investment Limited for early partial redemption of a convertible note, and will redeem $88M of a note issued to Zhongzhi in October 2016.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM | 3 Comments
  • AET

    Aetna perks up 1% on report that CVS takeover imminent

    • Aetna (AET +1.2%) is up 2.4% from its intraday low of $171 on a Dow Jones report that it could reach agreement to be acquired by CVS Health (CVS -0.8%) by the end of the month.
    • Previously: CVS/Aetna hope to seal deal as soon as December - Reuters (Nov. 3)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM | 26 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: ACST +136%. OPHC +60%. DCIX +27%. TSRI +26%. XNET +27%. EKSO +23%. CARV +25%. SRAX +19%. NTIC +18%. IMI +16%.
    • Losers: MICT -19%. CREG -12%. CHFS -11%. YECO-OLD -11%. CENX -10%. NBEV -10%. PRTA -9%. GNE -9%. LGND -9%. ORPN -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM | 1 Comment
  • RIO

    Bloomberg Gadfly: Rio Tinto's interest in SQM harbinger of lithium weakness

    • Rio Tinto (RIO +0.2%) is working with advisers on a bid for a stake in Sociedad Quimica & Minera de Chile (SQM -6.1%), according to Bloomberg, but Bloomberg's own David Fickling slams the idea, saying Rio tends to buy into commodities right when prices are about to slump.
    • "Over the years, Rio Tinto's major acquisitions have proved an eerily prescient contrarian indicator for commodities. When they buy, it's a good idea to sell," Fickling writes.
    • Bernstein analyst Paul Gait also fears Rio's interest is purely a move on the expectation of higher future lithium prices, and he thinks lithium is headed for oversupply and lithium carbonate prices will not climb much further, but hopes the company simply seeks access to SQM's data room.
    • "Information in such a process would presumably give detailed insight into SQM as a company and its place within the global lithium industry, and therefore would be particularly pertinent to Rio's own thinking around the Jadar project," Gait writes.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM | 24 Comments
  • PBSFY

    ProSiebenSat.1 higher as CEO exit fuels acquisition hopes

    • ProSiebenSat.1 (OTCPK:PBSFY) shares are up 4.7% in over-the-counter trading after an early exit from its CEO is restarting acquisition hopes for shareholders.
    • Thomas Ebeling -- criticized for slamming the company's customer base following a number of poor outlooks for the commercial broadcaster -- will now leave in February, earlier than expected.
    • He had targeted a transition to digital for the broadcaster but investors mostly ended up confused this year, and the company's stock has been one of the DAX's worst performers.
    • One potential buyer is NBCUniversal (CMCSA -0.3%), which previously indicated such an interest, though Comcast of late may be more interested in assets at Twenty-First Century Fox, and internationally focused Discovery Communications (DISCA -1.6%) has its hands currently full with a Scripps Networks (SNI -0.3%) acquisition.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM

  • Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Gainers: SQBG +13%. RELV +10%. FIZZ +7%. LMNR +6%. NAKD +5%.
    • Losers: NBEV -8%. ADOM -6%. WPRT -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • BIOC

    Biocept files for secondary equity offering; shares down 9%

    • Biocept (BIOC -8.5%) has filed a preliminary prospectus (S-1) for a public offering of stock and warrants. Prices, volumes and terms have yet to be finalized.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM | 18 Comments
  • MXWL

    Roth upgrades Maxwell Tech, ups price target

    • Roth Capital upgrades Maxwell Technologies (NASDAQ:MXWL) from Neutral to Buy and ups the price target by $2 to $7.
    • Latest analyst recommendations (via FT):  2 Outperform and 3 Hold. 
    • Median price target: $6.50. 
    • Maxwell shares are up 5.7%.  
    • Previously: Maxwell Technologies CEO acquires 230K shares (Nov. 15)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • UTSI

    UTStarcom to five-year high after product sales drive profit swing

    • UTStarcom Holdings (NASDAQ:UTSI) is up 11.8% on heavy volume and has hit a five-year high this morning after Q3 earnings where the company swung to a gain on revenues that grew nearly 60%.
    • Revenues of $26M surpassed one analyst estimate for $21M, with strength based on increased sales of 100G Packet Transport Network products.
    • Gross profit was $10.6M, making up 40.5% of net sales.
    • Net income, meanwhile, swung to a $2.2M gain vs. a loss of $1.8M a year ago.
    • Net sales breakout (non-GAAP): Equipment, $20.5M (up 98.3%); Services, $5.5M (down 8.4%).
    • Cash from operations was $1.9M; cash and equivalents as of Sept. 30 was $91.2M.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • VIS

    Shah Capital boosts stake in Vitamin Shoppe

    • Shah Capital Management discloses that it holds a passive stake of 13.45% in Vitamin Shoppe (VIS +0.5%).
    • The North Carolina-based investment firm reported a 5.45% position at the end Q3.
    • Shares of Vitamin Shoppe are down 83% YTD.
    • SEC Form 13G
     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • YNDX

    Yandex buys Foodfox to expand Uber Eats, RBC says

    • Yandex (YNDX +1.8%) has bought food-delivery service Foodfox for its Yandex.Taxi unit, RBC says, though Yandex calls the report "speculation."
    • Such a deal would help the company expand Uber Eats in Russia, following the merger of that business with Yandex.Taxi in Russia and the Commonwealth of Independent States.
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM
  • DCPH

    Deciphera Pharma's lead candidate shows positive effect in early-stage glioma study; shares ahead 6%

    • Thinly traded Deciphera Pharmaceuticals (DCPH +6.4%) perks up on light volume on the heels of its announcement of positive interim data from a Phase 1 clinical trial evaluating lead candidate DCC-2618 in patients with malignant gliomas, highly treatment-resistant cancers that occur in the brain and spinal cord. The results were presented at the Scientific Meeting and Education Day of the Society for Neuro-Oncology in San Francisco.
    • Off four evaluable patients with glioblastoma multiforme (GBM), one experienced a partial response with 94% tumor reduction at week 84.
    • In the safety population (n=70), DCC-2618 was generally well-tolerated. Three dose-limiting toxicities were observed but were not considered clinically significant.
    • DCC-2618 inhibits certain kinase enzymes (KIT and PDDGa) that play a key role in the proliferation and survival of certain cancers, including GBM, gastrointestinal stromal tumors and systemic mastocytosis.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM | 1 Comment

  • Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am

    • Gainers: ACST +77%. EKSO +21%. XOMA +12%. TCMD +12%. RIOT +10%.
    • Losers: CELC -10%. AAC -9%. CHFS -8%. SBPH -7%. BIVV -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM
  • BCS

    Two-notch upgrade for Barclays; shares up 2%

    • Things have sufficiently bottomed-out for Barclays (BCS +2.1%) after shares underperformed the broad EU bank sector by 29% this year, says BAML, upgrading to Buy from Underperform.
    • The lender should be able to meet its 10% ROE target, with half of the plan coming from "low hanging fruit," and the other half from "plausible growth" and a turnaround in the investment bank.
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM | 2 Comments
  • PTR

    Three dead due to apparent gas leak at PetroChina refinery

    • Three workers were killed and six others injured during a suspected gas leak at a refinery operated by PetroChina (PTR -2.1%) in Dalian over the weekend.
    • The men working for Henan Yanling Jingshun Petrochemical Machinery Equipment Co. were carrying out maintenance at the West Pacific Petrochemical plant in Liaoning province.
    • Production at the 200K bbl/day plant reportedly was not affected by the accident.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM
  • CHEK

    Check-Cap secures $2.5M direct capital raise; shares down 3%

    • Check-cap (CHEK -3.4%) inks agreements with institutional investors to sell 2,272,640 ordinary shares at $1.10 per share. Buyers will also receive unregistered five-year warrants to purchase up to 1,704,480 ordinary shares at $1.25.
    • Gross proceeds will be ~$2.5M (~$4.6M if the warrants are exercised in full).
    • Net proceeds will fund the continued development of C-Scan and general corporate purposes.
    • Friday's close was $1.19.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • ACST

    Acasti Pharma advancing potential deal to commercialize CaPre in Asia; shares ahead 75%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Acasti Pharma (ACST +74.8%) is up on a whopping 317x surge in volume in response to its announcement that it has entered into a non-binding term sheet with a leading Chinese pharmaceutical company that it expects to lead to a formal license agreement for the commercialization high triglyceride treatment CaPre (omega-3 phospholipid) in certain Asian countries including China.
    • Under the terms of the formal agreement, if consummated, Acasti will receive $8M upfront, up to $125M in milestones and tiered double-digit royalties on net sales.
    • Previously: Acasti Pharma to proceed with late-stage development of CaPre for the treatment of high triglycerides; shares ahead 7% (March 30)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM | 1 Comment
  • AMC

    Theater stocks in retreat after Justice League disappoints

    • Theater stocks are in reverse after box office numbers for Justice League disappointed.
    • The Warner Bros. superhero film failed to reach $100M for its opening weekend and only earned a B+ rating from CinemaScore.
    • Decliners include AMC Entertainment (NYSE:AMC) -4.8%, Cinemark Holdings (NYSE:CNK) -2.8%, IMAX (NYSE:IMAX) -2.8%, Regal Entertainment (NYSE:RGC) -2.8%, Marcus Corp (NYSE:MCS) -1.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM | 10 Comments
  • MKSI

    Index adds lift MKS Instruments, Invesco Mortgage, Tactile Systems

    • With Brocade Systems sold to Broadcom, MKS Instruments (MKSI +2.4%) will replace it in the S&P MidCap 400, effective Wednesday.
    • Replacing MKS in the S&P SmallCap 600 will be Invesco Mortgage (IVR +3.8%).
    • Tactile Systems (TCMD +11.6%) is replacing Lumos Networks in the S&P SmallCap 600 as Lumos' sale to EQT Infrastructure closed today.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM
  • DLPH

    Delphi Automotive rallies on M&A buzz

    • Shares of Delphi Automotive (DLPH +3%) are active in morning trading on some M&A speculation.
    • Bank of America Merrill Lynch kickstarted the action by suggesting that the early timeline for the company's spin-off could indicate one of the new entities is a target of interested buyers looking to boost their autonomous, shared mobility or electric car businesses.
    • BAML upgrades Delphi to Buy from Neutral and assigns a price target of $120.
    • Sources: Bloomberg, CNBC
     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM | 1 Comment
  • FLXN

    Flexion launches Zilretta in U.S.; shares ahead 2%

    • Flexion Therapeutics (FLXN +1.9%) commences the full U.S. commercial launch of ZILRETTA (triamcinolone acetonide extended-release injectable suspension) for the treatment of knee pain due to osteoarthritis. The FDA approved it last month and it has been available on a limited basis since October 23.
    • The company says it has hired over 100 sales reps to promote the product.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM
  • MNST

    Susquehanna negative on Monster Beverage

    • Monster Beverage (MNST -0.9%) trades lower after taking on a downgrade from Susquehanna.
    • Analyst Pablo Zuanic warns about "misplaced" enthusiasm over a Coca-Cola bid for the beverage company.
    • "We think the run-up is explained by expectations KO would announce or hint at a purchase of MNST at last week’s seminar. But with FCF at KO pretty much all going to dividends, and the company stating share buybacks would only be done to cover stock option dilution, we are hard pressed to see KO forking our $34Bn (taking a 20% premium) to buy the 82% of shares it does not own," reasons Zuanic.
    • Susquehanna drops Monster to Negative from Neutral and sets a price target of $51 (17% downside).
     
     
     
     
    | 9:40 AM | 2 Comments
  • TCEHY

    Tencent crosses $500B market cap

    • Tencent (OTCPK:TCEHY, OTCPK:TCTZF) pushed over a $500B valuation today as shares rose over 4% following last week’s stellar earnings report.
    • Tencent becomes the first Chinese tech company to cross that mark.
    • Alibaba’s market cap is $60.7B, and Baidu stands at $10.6B.       
    • Previously: Tencent reports stellar Q3, plans increased focus on digital content (Nov. 15)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:36 AM | 38 Comments
  • BITA

    Bitauto -7.3% as Yixin options drive wider loss

    • Bitauto Holdings (NYSE:BITA) is 7.3% lower premarket after missing expectations with a headline loss that widened due to newly granted options in its Q3 earnings report.
    • Net loss grew to 510.2M yuan (about $76.2M) from a loss of 47.4M yuan ($7.1M) a year ago, mainly due to newly grated options by Yixin to its employees in Q3. Non-GAAP net income rose 78.5%, though, to 231.8M yuan (about $34.8M).
    • Non-GAAP diluted EPS was $0.23.
    • Revenue by business: Advertising and subscriptions, 1.07B yuan ($161.1M), up 19.3%: Transaction services, 1.05B yuan ($158.4M), up 145.7%; Digital marketing solutions, 218.9M yuan ($32.9M), up 10.6%.
    • Cash and equivalents came to 6.49B yuan ($975M). Employees were up 33.8% Y/Y to 8,379.
    • For Q4 it's expecting revenues of 2.4B-2.45B yuan ($360.7M-$368.2M, a 37.2%-40.1% increase Y/Y and in line with expectations for $362.33M). Excluding direct vehicle sales, the forecast is a 51.2%-54.3% net revenue gain Y/Y.

    • FDA has granted Fast Track designation to Intra-Cellular Therapies (NASDAQ:ITCI) for lumateperone for the treatment of schizophrenia.
    • The FDA’s Fast Track designation is designed to facilitate the development and expedite the review of drug candidates to treat serious and life-threatening conditions.     • Lumateperone, is a molecule that provides selective and simultaneous modulation of serotonin, dopamine, and glutamate—three neurotransmitter pathways implicated in severe mental illness.

  • MRK

    Merck under pressure premarket on positive data Tecentriq data in lung cancer, shares down 2% premarket

    • Merck (NYSE:MRK) is down 2% premarket on increased volume in apparent reaction to Roche's (OTCQX:RHHBY) announcement of positive Phase 3 data on the combination of TECENTRIQ (atezolizumab), Avastin (bevacizumab) and chemo (paclitaxel and carboplatin) in patients with advanced nonsquamous non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC).
    • In a first-line setting, treatment with TECENTRIQ produced a statistically significant and clinically meaningful reduction in progression-free survival (PFS) compared to Avastin plus chemo. Overall survival data should be available in H1 2018.
    • The results will be presented next month at ESMO in Geneva.
    • Merck's KEYTRUDA (pembrolizumab) is also approved to treat nonsquamous NSCLC in a first-line setting.
    • Roche is up 7% in Switzerland.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:47 AM | 2 Comments

    • Alnylam Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ALNY) announces that the FDA has granted Breakthrough Therapy Designation (BTD) for patisiran, an investigational RNAi therapeutic targeting transthyretin for the treatment of adults with hereditary transthyretin-mediated ATTR amyloidosis with polyneuropathy.
    • BTD is intended to expedite the development and review of drugs for the treatment of serious or life-threatening conditions based on clinical evidence.

    • Citing a lack of confidence that it could ensure patients safety by weekly white blood cell count screening, Acorda Therapeutics (NASDAQ:ACOR) terminates development of Parkinson's disease candidate tozadenant.   • ZIOP

    ZIOPHARM's gene therapy candidate Ad-RTS-hIL-12 shows positive effect in treatment-resistant brain cancer in early-stage study; shares ahead 13% premarket

    • ZIOPHARM (NASDAQ:ZIOP) is up 13% premarket on average volume on the heels of its announcement of positive results from a Phase 1 clinical trial assessing Ad-RTS-hIL-12 + veledimex in patients with recurrent glioblastoma (rGBM). The data were presented at the 22nd Annual Meeting and Education Day of the Society for Neuro-Oncology in San Francisco.
    • Patients treated with Ad-RTS-hIL-12 plus 20 mg of veledimex (n=20) experienced median overall survival (OS) of 12.5 months compared to five-to-eights months historically in these patients.
    • Four rGM patients in the treatment group who also received low-dose steroids were all surviving at a median follow-up 11.1 months.
    • Ad-RTS-hIL-12 is a novel gene therapy candidate for the controlled expression of interleukin-12 (IL-12), an essential protein for stimulating a T cell immune response to cancer. Veledimex is an oral activator ligand or "gene switch" which is used to control the expression of IL-12, a pro-inflammatory cytokine that produces serious side effects if over-expressed.
    • Previously: ZIOPHARM to update investors on gene therapy candidate for brain cancer November 20 (Nov. 17)
    • Update: Shares are now down 7% as investors appear underwhelmed with the data presented during the conference call this morning.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:42 AM | 17 Comments
